title: 820-01987 dead
message:
It is the first voltage you need to get.
Check diode mode to ground there.
If good, post U7000 basic voltages; P_IN, AUX_DET, VDDA/P, SMC_RST_IN, A/BMON.

title: 820-01987 dead
message:
T2 boards have different power on sequence than old boards.
3V3_G3H_RTC comes from PPBUS_G3H...

title: 820-01987 dead
message:
U7000 MUST generate PPBUS_G3H without any control from T2; even with just 5V from USB-C input.
Compare diode mode to ground at pin 2/F7000 with good board.

Consider to change Q7030/40 and check R/C7030/40.

title: 820-01987 dead
message:
That means PPBUS_G3H is not properly controlled.
U7000 needs to communicate with T2 for this.

You may have a problem with I2C battery bus, or T2 corrupted software.
Try DFU revive first.
If no important SSD data, go for restore; if revive didn't help.

If can't enter DFU, check if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages come on; at corresponding small coils around U7800.

i checked the awake and slps2r lines they are fine too. 

I hope you have some new ideas for me.

and sorry i am a beginner in Macbook repairs

title: 820-01987 dead
message: i think i did all correctly. I short 1V8 to Force DFU and connect typ C cable to host macbook. I did one more measurement and noticed that the macbook havent voltages when the battery is connected. What do you think about that? I have only when the cable is connected.

title: 820-01987 dead
message:
Connect both charger and battery for DFU.
Some machines don't complete DFU without battery.
Be sure to use dedicated USB-C port for DFU.
